contentrichtext.text: <noinclude>{{../doc}} {{divhide|Staging area}} ==Images== Use only ONE image at a time <gallery> File:Louisiana purchase treaty.jpg|Louisiana Purchase treaty File:Felix Dzerzhinsky 1919.jpg|Cheka director Felix Edmundovich Dzerzhinsky File:EBR-1 2001.jpg|Experimental Breeder Reactor I File:First four nuclear lit bulbs.jpeg|Four light bulbs were lit with electricity generated from the EBR-1 reactor. File:KGB Symbol.png|The sword-and-shield emblem of the Cheka-KGB File:Oldmacauflag.PNG|Flag of Concelho de Macau, one of the two concelhos of Macau under Portuguese rule File:Doña Paz at Tacloban.jpg|MV Doña Paz in port File:Luis Carrero Blanco.jpg|Luis Carrero Blanco </gallery> ==Ineligible== {|class="wikitable" |- !Blurb !Reason |- | [[1803]] – As part of the [[Louisiana Purchase]], [[New Orleans]] in the [[Louisiana (New France)|French territory of Louisiana]] '''[[History of New Orleans|was officially transferred]]''' to the United States. | refimprove |- | [[1917]] – The '''[[Cheka]]''', the first [[Chronology of Soviet secret police agencies|Soviet secret police]], was established by a decree issued by [[Vladimir Lenin]]. | refimprove |- | [[1941]] – [[World War II]]: The '''[[Flying Tigers]]''' of the [[Republic of China Air Force|Chinese Air Force]] engaged in its first combat missions. | refimprove section |- | [[1973]] – [[Prime Minister of Spain|Spanish Prime Minister]] '''[[Luis Carrero Blanco]]''' ''(pictured)'' [[Operación Ogro|was assassinated]]<!--Not bolded, stubby--> by a bomb planted by members of the [[Basque nationalist]] and separatist group [[ETA]]. | needs more footnotes |- | [[1995]] – As per the [[Dayton Agreement]] that ended the [[Bosnian War]], the [[NATO]]-led '''[[Implementation Force (IFOR)|IFOR]]''' began peacekeeping operations in [[Bosnia and Herzegovina]]. | Tagged with {{tl|missing citations}} |} ==Eligible== {{*mp}} [[1951]] – '''[[Experimental Breeder Reactor I|Experimental Breeder Reactor I]]''' near [[Arco, Idaho]], US, became the world's first [[electricity]]-generating [[nuclear power plant]] when it produced sufficient electricity to illuminate four 200-[[watt]] [[light bulb]]s. {{*mp}} [[1987]] – The deadliest peacetime [[List of maritime disasters|maritime disaster]] in history occurred when the '''{{MV|Doña Paz}}''' sank after colliding with an [[oil tanker]] on the [[Tablas Strait]] in the Philippines, resulting in an estimated 4,000 deaths. {{*mp}} [[1968]] – The '''[[Zodiac Killer]]''' murdered the first of his five confirmed victims in [[Vallejo, California]], a case which remains unsolved. {{*mp}} [[1988]] – The '''[[United Nations Convention Against Illicit Traffic in Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances]]''' governing international cooperation against the [[illegal drug trade]] was signed in [[Vienna]]. {{*mp}} [[1989]] – American forces '''[[United States invasion of Panama|invaded]]''' Panama to overthrow the government of [[Manuel Noriega]]. {{*mp}} [[1995]] – '''[[American Airlines Flight 965]]''' crashed into a mountain in [[Buga, Valle del Cauca|Buga, Colombia]], killing 151 passengers and 8 crew members. {{*mp}} [[2005]] – [[United States district court|US district court]] Judge [[John E. Jones III]] ruled against mandating the teaching of "[[intelligent design]]" in his ruling of '''''[[Kitzmiller v. Dover Area School District]]'''''. </ul> ==Notes== {{*mp}} [[SilkAir Flight 185]] appears on [[Wikipedia:Selected anniversaries/December 19|December 19]], so American Airlines Flight 965 should not appear in the same year {{divhide|end}} </noinclude> '''[[December 20]]''' <div style="float:right;margin-left:0.5em"> [[File:It's A Wonderful Life.jpg|Donna Reed, James Stewart, and Karolyn Grimes in "It's a Wonderful Life"|100x100px]] </div> {{*mp}} [[1860]] – [[South Carolina]]<!--Not bolded, tagged with {{tl|isbn}}--> became the first of eleven [[slave state]]s to secede from the United States, leading to the eventual creation of the '''[[Confederate States of America]]''' and later the [[American Civil War]]. {{*mp}} [[1946]] – [[Frank Capra]]'s popular Christmas film '''''[[It's a Wonderful Life]]''''' ''(pictured)'' was first released in New York City. {{*mp}} [[1955]] – '''[[Cardiff]]''' was proclaimed as the [[capital city|capital]] of [[Wales]]. {{*mp}} [[1999]] – Portugal [[Transfer of sovereignty over Macau|transferred sovereignty]]<!--Not bolded, refimprove--> of '''[[Macau]]''', which it had administered since the mid-16th century, to China. {{*mp}} [[2007]] – [[Pablo Picasso]]'s '''''[[Portrait of Suzanne Bloch]]''''' was stolen from the [[São Paulo Museum of Art]]. </ul> {{SelAnnivFooter|Month=December|Day=20}} <noinclude> </noinclude>
